title: Exercise: Define Schema from a Schema Table or Schema Feature

questions.question: Columns in an externally-defined schema table must contain columns named FeatureType, AttributeName, AttrDataType, etc.
Why did you set the resource reader format to Schema (From Table) instead of Microsoft Excel?
options: The Schema (From Table) reader allows you to choose which columns define attribute names, data types, etc.
If you chose a Microsoft Excel table as the external schema source, the writer feature type would automatically write to Excel, even if another format was defined on the writer.
Resource readers cannot use the Microsoft Excel format.
You cannot create schema features from the Microsoft Excel format.

questions.question: What is the advantage of using schema features in this scenario?
options: All features automatically have schema list attributes, so you don't have to use any special configurations to benefit from them.
Schema features result in much faster writing than using external tables to define schema.
You don't have to map the old schema onto the new schema in order for FME to write attribute values.
You can update the external Excel table to automatically update the destination schema.
